TopicTitle: Please, can somebody tell me how this works?

Articles.Content:
Okay, try staring at this with your sound on for like, 5 seconds. After 2 seconds I start questioning the universe, thinking of paradoxes, all done super quickly, and sometimes hitting my own keyboard. I think extremely quick from my perspective, like in a half of a second I made up a story about time travel which included a paradox. I also might have discovered a way to travel in time. Might also be because its 4:32 Am and Im writting homework for today. Im pretty worried. I also slowly forget what I was thinking during the "drift" (+1 if you get the reference) or the period in which I was starring. A half of second later I start panicking and paranoia kicks in and I start thinking about being watched by aliens *adjusts tinfoil hat*. My heartbeat also increases rapidly.

EDIT: Damnit, forgot to add the link. I do not suffer from epilepsia or anything similiar.

http://gifsound.com/?gif=i.imgur.com/3tMNN.gif&v=jlf3herfbL8&s=100

Edited May 19, 2014 by EvilotionCR2
You might want to cut back on the caffeine intake.
The only thing that happens with me is that my eyes start to hurt and fill with tears after some time...

You might want to cut back on the caffeine intake.

Yeah, I'm with you on that one.

You're straining too much.

http://s15.postimg.org/h5w31inbf/Image1.png

Good point.

I dont drink coffee, Im eleven.

I've been drinking coffee since I was 9, also, I've lost any possible shred of respect for you.

You really shouldn't drink coffee. Ever. If you can have a lifestyle where you don't need coffee, then don't drink it. Brain develops a habit after a while, and you can't properly wake up without it. It's a viscious circle. If you can, sleep longer, but don't mess with your brain.

Dunno what you people are talking about, I took a look and immediately I had vivid pictures forming in my mind when I was viewing the static-ishness. Will have too look again later. Perhaps this phenomenon only affects certain people?

I looked at the picture, heard some noise, and drank coffee.

There are no words to describe the nothing that happened.

I've been drinking coffee since I was 9, also, I've lost any possible shred of respect for you.

How dare these foolish peons be young!

That is actually a nice tear generator.

I'm not even joking.

Will come in handy when something gets in my eye.

I host it here just in case I need to question about the universe but I don't remember the URL anymore.

http://function1.nl/ques/tions.html

But how does it work? I have no idea.
Hmm nothing. not even tears. Maybe it only work with kids.
D-27771, please perform an additional trial and log your thoughts. More data is needed by the Foundation to attempt to replicate the memetic effect in other subjects.

I see things in it.

I saw 666, a face, a Swastika, some symbols that I can't tell what they mean, then it keeps showing the word SWAG in russian styled font.
